intro: Strobilanthes timorensis, commonly known as the Timor flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
